diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of porphyria cutanea tarda (PCT) was made based on a history of skin fragility, hyperpigmentation, and skin eruptions, along with elevated urinary uroporphyrin levels and decreased activity of uroporphyrinogen (URO)-decarboxylase in liver tissue. The patient also had notable elevations in serum iron and ferritin levels, which are known triggers for PCT.
